name: Windsor Hotel

reviews.text: We were dreading coming here after seeing the reviews on trip advisor , we shouldn't have taken any notice , the hotel is a lovely traditional Scottish hotel with lots of character , the staff were lovely all very friendly and the meals were cooked to perfection!!!!
reviews.title: Don't believe the reviews , try it. For yourself

reviews.text: I will definitely be returning
reviews.title: Dirty, so dirty!

reviews.text: Thank you again for a wonderful stay
reviews.title: Absolutely bloody awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It´s very dirty, and a employer showed me the kitchen, ohhh my good, i won able to eat more there.. asquerous places
reviews.title: Overnight stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a very enjoyable 4 nights in the Windsor as part of a coach tour. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit wary so it therefore came as a pleasant surprise to find our party welcomed by the manager personally and we were given the key to a great room on the 3d floor. Comfy beds, T.V., ample wardrobe and drawer space. Goodsized bathroom with bath and shower over the bath. Roasting hot water and lovely white thick towels. The towels were changed every day whether they were all used or not. The bathroom looked spanking new! The towel heater in the bathroom was turned off as seemingly it gets too hot to touch so we just left the bedroom door open and it heated the bathroom. The hall and stairways were always warm and cosy. In fact some people were complaining of the heat but that particular week the weather had turned unseasonally good! One complaint was no lift. There was a lot of elderly folk on our trip who found the stairs hard going. We had been told the lift was out of order before booking so we had the choice of booking or not but it didn't seem to me that it was getting any attention, and it was not codoned off! The food was fair and always warm. Could have done with a better choice of veg. We had 2 veg every night but one of them was always carrots! Rost potatoes every night too. Although nice could have been a boiled potatoe an odd night. The staff were always attentive and Scott, the manager always eager to please. All in all a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: March Break

reviews.text: Went for a family meal, soup barely warm, fish terrible only good thing to say about the meal was they managed to get the dessert cold ,it was icecream. Service, food , curtains hanging off in main restaurant,no napkins, long wait for meal. Very embarrasing for Nairn where i live,will never be back,under this management.
reviews.title: Ghastly food !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value for beautiful sunday carvery nice cosy dining room great service from bar staff
reviews.title: Sunday carvery

reviews.text: and waiters recommended to all. £12.20 for 2 people including 2 soft drinks desserts £2.25
reviews.title: Terrible.

reviews.text: extra we will definately return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Will be back soon!

reviews.text: Have just returned from 5 day stay in this hotel and have nothing but praise for all services provided. The bedroom my friend and I shared was very comfortable, clean,and well equipped as was the bathroom with both bath and shower [plenty of very hot water]. The service in dinning room and bar was first class with a menu of ample choices of good food well cooked and hot. Scott the manager and staff were friendly, helpful and very obliging, after asking for a wine they did not stock it appeared the next day. How's that for service. I have not hesitation in recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: unreliable reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed for 3 nights in the hotel,
reviews.title: Other Reviews = False advertising

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very easy to find and is only 5 mins away from the town centre.
reviews.title: Great value , excellent accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived we felt at home, we were welcomed in by friendly reception staff who dealt with us quickly and were detailed on where our room was and how to contact staff if there was any problems.
reviews.title: Try this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very spacious and clean and easy to find.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I must begin by saying that I stay at a lot of hotels in many countries. This has been the worst ever. I am extremely suspicious of the 'excellent' reviews here, they must have been written by someone with a bag on their head or by a member of staff.
reviews.title: If you are reading this - I wish I had

reviews.text: On arrival was greeted by the odour of stale cooking oil and damp, not the greatest of starts. That alone meant that there was no chance of me eating in this place. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming, putting a brace face on what I think they knew was a lost cause.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor of the corridors and stairs leading to the room was an unusual mix of 60s wood chip, glitzy geometric carpet, peeling paint and trendy pictures. Whilst reasonably clean the place did need a good clear out, clean up and re-decoration.
reviews.title: wonderful stay, big differance in early reviews
Welcoming & friendly
reviews.text: The room was of a decent size given the cost (which was reasonable I guess). Linen and towels of a good quality and clean. You know it is bad, however, when you know you would not want to take your shoes off and walk on the carpet or the bathroom floor. The window would not close properly, something I wanted to do given the forecast north wind and snow that evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nevertheless, I decided to stay. It was pre-paid!
reviews.title: Many thanks Scott & Staff...

description: The Windsor Hotel is set only a few miles from Inverness and in the best residential area of Nairn. One of the closest hotels to Inverness Airport and near to the major trunk routes.Beautiful sandy beaches, putting green, children's adventure play park, swimming pool, squash courts and full leisure facilities are also within easy reach of the hotel. Nairn, with its unique micro climate, is an ideal touring centre for the Highlands of Scotland, close to Inverness, Loch Ness and all that it has to offer. Only 15 minutes from Cawdor Castle and Culloden Battlefield. It is a perfect break whatever your interest - Whiskey Trail, Heritage, Touring, Walking and Golfing.
